googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Iowa driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Your ID number is your Iowa driver's license number (or Iowa non‐driver identification number) if you have one, if not then the last four digits of your social security number.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every active registered voter will receive an **absentee ballot application** in the mail.
* Any registered Iowa voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Elections Division  
Office of the Secretary of State  
Lucas Building‐1st Floor  
321 E. 12th Street  
Des Moines, IA 50319
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Iowa voters will be asked to show photo ID when voting.  Acceptable forms of photo ID include a non-expired Iowa Drivers License or non-operator ID, a US passport, a military ID card, a veterans ID card, a tribal ID card, or an employee ID issued by the federal government or the state of Iowa.  You can also show your voter ID card.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: For the November 3, 2020 election, every active registered voter will receive an **absentee ballot application** in the mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You may register with a party in advance if you want to take part in that party’s primary election. You may change or declare a party affiliation at the polls on primary election day.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need an Iowa ID to use Iowa's online voter registration system. If you do not have an Iowa ID, you can still register to vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: You will need to provide your Iowa driver license number, or your Iowa non-operator ID number, your Iowa voter ID card four-digit PIN number on your **absentee ballot application**.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Iowa you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Iowa
  * be at least 17 years old (you must be 18 to vote)
  * not have been convicted of a felony (or have had your rights restored)
  * not currently be judged by a court to be “incompetent to vote”
  * not claim the right to vote in more than one place
